Returns: all the headers of this message
getAllHeaders().Description: Returns all the headers of this message. Headers are orderd in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.

Returns: the last header whose name property equals name. or null if no such header could be found.
Parameters: the name of the header to return.
getLastHeader(java.lang.String).Description: Returns the last header with a specified name of this message. Header values are ignored. If there is more than one matching header in the message the last element of @B_org#apache#http#HttpMessage#getHeaders_E@ is returned. If there is no matching header in the message null is returned.

addHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.St.Description: Adds a header to this message. The header will be appended to the end of the list.
addHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.St.FullName: public abstract void addHeader (String name, String value)

Parameters: the array of headers to set.
setHeaders(org.apache.http.Header[]).Description: Overwrites all the headers in the message.

Returns: Iterator that returns Header objects with the argument name in the sequence they are sent over a connection.
Parameters: the name of the headers over which to iterate, or null for all headers
headerIterator(java.lang.String).Description: Returns an iterator of the headers with a given name.

Returns: the first header whose name property equals name or null if no such header could be found.
Parameters: the name of the header to return.
getFirstHeader(java.lang.String).Description: Returns the first header with a specified name of this message. Header values are ignored. If there is more than one matching header in the message the first element of @B_org#apache#http#HttpMessage#getHeaders_E@ is returned. If there is no matching header in the message null is returned.

Parameters: The name of the headers to remove.
removeHeaders(java.lang.String).Description: Removes all headers with a certain name from this message.

Returns: true if at least one header with this name is present.
Parameters: the header name to check for.
containsHeader(java.lang.String).Description: Checks if a certain header is present in this message. Header values are ignored.

getParams().Description: Returns the parameters effective for this message as set by @B_org#apache#http#HttpMessage#setParams_E@.

addHeader(org.apache.http.Header).Description: Adds a header to this message. The header will be appended to the end of the list.

setHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.St.Description: Overwrites the first header with the same name. The new header will be appended to the end of the list, if no header with the given name can be found.
setHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.St.FullName: public abstract void setHeader (String name, String value)

removeHeader(org.apache.http.Header).Description: Removes a header from this message.

getProtocolVersion().Description: Returns the protocol version this message is compatible with.

setParams(org.apache.http.params.HttpPar.Description: Provides parameters to be used for the processing of this message.

setHeader(org.apache.http.Header).Description: Overwrites the first header with the same name. The new header will be appended to the end of the list, if no header with the given name can be found.

Returns: the headers whose name property equals name.
Parameters: the name of the headers to return.
getHeaders(java.lang.String).Description: Returns all the headers with a specified name of this message. Header values are ignored. Headers are orderd in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.
